Desc.entry: Part of Sheffield Libraries, Archives and Information. Stock and facilities include: A3 and A4 photocopier, language tapes, talking books, DVDs, CD-Roms, local newspapers, community language material and exhibition space available. Activities include basic IT support, Councillors surgeries, school classes, children's holiday fun activities, Leaf Community Allotment Project (see separate entry) and Southey Forum (see separate entry). The library has a meeting room for hire. Toilets for the public available. Provides 8 People's Network computers with Microsoft Office, Internet access and 1 scanner available for public use.

ProviderServiceDetails.entry: Mon 9.30am-12.30pm, 1.30-6pm, Tues & Thurs closed, Wed & Fri 9.30am-12.30pm, 1.30-5.30pm, Sat 9.30am-12.30pm (opening times); Mon & Fri 10am-1pm (Next Steps, Anxiety and Depression Support Group), Wed 9.45-11.45am (Foxhill and Parson Cross Advice Centre), 10-11am (coffee morning), 3rd Mon in the month (IT support session)
